report_title: Organic Chemical Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Revenue in the industry tends to expand when industrial activity improves. Downstream manufacturers often respond to growing demand by purchasing more raw materials in anticipation of higher production levels. However, industry revenue has experienced volatility due to the pandemic because of rising raw material prices, logistics issues and supply-side constraints in the years following the pandemic. Also, concerns have been surrounding demand because of the economic slowdown caused by inflationary pressure in the latter part of the current period. However, industry-wide revenue still grew at a CAGR of 4.0% to $160.0 billion over the past five years, despite a 2.2% dip in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Downstream manufacturing has been affected by the hike in interest rates
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Organic chemical manufacturing's demand correlates with the activity level of industries using its products, like the Plastic and Resin Manufacturing industry (IBISWorld report 32521), which buys phenols for plastic laminate production. Interest rate hikes in 2022 and 2023 have severely impacted downstream manufacturing industries, increased borrowing expenses, caused a drop in profitability and restricted the market demand for organic chemical products.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Fluctuations in raw material prices lead to volatility in revenue growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Organic chemical prices have been significantly volatile because of constant fluctuations in raw material prices, particularly oil. As oil is the primary expense for the organic chemical industry, any shift in oil prices directly impacts the costs of these chemicals. The world price of crude oil has jumped significantly, causing industry purchase costs to rise. Significant raw material prices have put downward pressure on industry profit at the same time. The predicted drop in corn prices in 2024 is expected to moderate associated industry costs, which in turn may slow the pace of revenue growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Stringent regulations have boosted production costs
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Regulatory authorities and governments frequently enforce stringent rules on manufacturers to guarantee public health, environmental safety and consumer protection. Manufacturers invest in research and development to formulate innovative products in response to regulatory pressure, which inevitably hikes overall production costs. Overseas manufacturers in countries like China can benefit from reduced regulation and lower wage costs, giving them a competitive edge in the domestic market.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Advancements in technology have supported industry growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Advancements in process engineering and technological innovations have significantly transformed organic chemical manufacturing. They have enabled more efficient, compact methods, reducing resource consumption and increasing production yield. Biocatalysis is playing a growing role in organic chemical manufacturing. According to the National Library of Medicine, "Biocatalysts place substrates in ideal positions to each other, enabling precise control of the reaction resulting in high chemo- and stereoselectivity. This opens new methods for organic synthesis."

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The need for organic chemical manufacturing will decline
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: - The Plastic and Resin Manufacturing industry (IBISWorld report 32521) will invest in bioplastics made from renewable sources like biomasses, lowering demand for organic chemical manufacturers. - Organic chemical manufacturers will likely encounter less demand for ethanol as various countries enhance their in-house ethanol production capabilities.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Regulatory pressure in the industry will change the industry landscape
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Organic chemical manufacturers will likely face higher regulatory costs in the upcoming five years, driven by escalating environmental and safety concerns associated with climate change. Organic chemical manufacturers, among others, will transition from crude oil to renewable energy sources, significantly lowering the energy costs incurred in their manufacturing processes.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Manufacturers will reduce costs to maintain profit
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: With the development of automated solutions in the manufacturing process, this industry will embrace these changes, which can help enhance productivity and cut wage costs. Organic chemical manufacturers will establish contracts with suppliers to secure cost-effective raw materials. These strategic partnerships will enable them to competitively price their products, ensuring a stronger market positioning. In addition, the shift away from crude oil and towards renewable energy will reduce operating costs, helping to push industry profit higher.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The drop in the trade-weighted index will likely support domestic demand and limit revenue declines
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The trade-weighted index, which began to depreciate during the tail end of the previous period, will drop. As a result, total industry imports will face decelerated growth, as a weaker dollar will make domestic industry goods relatively more favorable. Domestic companies will remain stable by providing more value-added products to their product mix. As a result, exports as a share of revenue are expected to expand to one-third of industry revenue.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures basic organic chemicals (other than petrochemicals), industrial gases and synthetic dyes and pigments. Key product groups include gum and wood products, cyclic crudes and intermediates, ethyl alcohol and other basic organic chemicals. These products are predominantly intermediates that are used as raw material inputs by other manufacturing industries in the production of downstream products.

threats: Demand from plastic and resin manufacturing

key_trends: Price, customer service and customer reach drive industry competition. Given the commoditized nature of organic chemicals, prices are the central tenet of competition.
Capital is often required to adhere to government regulations. Complying with new regulations is a large competitive factor.

Interest rate hikes throughout the period have affected downstream industries, reducing organic chemical demand. However, technology advancements, particularly in biocatalysis, have improved reaction control, enhancing efficiency in organic chemical manufacturing.
Manufacturers in this industry and other manufacturing-based industries that rely on crude oil will convert to renewables. This will help manufacturers lower energy costs.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Plastic and resin manufacturers extensively use industrial chemicals like phenols and styrene, along with dyes and pigments, throughout their production process.
Citric acid, ascorbic acid and sodium benzoate are examples of organic chemicals used as preservatives and additives in the food and beverage manufacturing industry.
Other industry manufacturing includes sectors like agricultural chemicals, along with industries that produce inks, pharmaceuticals and perfumes.

products_and_services.product_description: Ethyl alcohol, also known as ethanol, is essential in numerous industrial operations. It's a key ingredient in gasoline, used in antiseptics and necessary for producing certain chemicals.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Cyclic Crudes, Coal Tar, Wood Chemical and Intermediate Products
products_and_services.product_description: Organic chemical manufacturers produce cyclic crudes or intermediates like hydrocarbons from refined petroleum or natural gas. Products include aniline, benzoic acid, phenol and chlorotoluene. Included are gum and wood chemical products.

products_and_services.product_or_service: All Other Basic Organic Chemical Products
products_and_services.product_description: Key segments include fatty acids, synthetic organic alcohols, synthetic flavor and perfume materials, bulk pesticides and all other basic organic chemical products. Manufacturing consumer goods heavily relies on these organic chemicals.
Provides fatty acids used in various industrial applications.
Key industrial alcohols required in diverse applications.
Synthetic materials used in flavoring and fragrance applications.
Pesticides produced for agricultural and industrial use.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Many organic chemical products are intermediates used by manufacturers in production of final goods. A decrease in the industrial production index, which measures output from mining, manufacturing, electric and gas industries, directly affects demand for organic chemical manufacturing.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Importers Benefit From a Rising US Dollar
international_trade_points.trade_description: The rising US dollar made foreign products relatively less expensive, encouraging import hikes. Imports saw a rebound due to economic revival in 2021 and resumption of trade activities.
Less stringent environmental regulations and lower labor costs in foreign nations enable producers to manufacture and market products at reduced prices, leading to fierce domestic competition.
Organic chemical exports have grown as manufacturers sought to expand reach into foreign markets. Mexico and Canada are main export destinations due to USMCA, conditions and proximity.
The pandemic disrupted supply chains and manufacturing, leading to shutdowns, labor shortages, raw material scarcity and transportation hurdles worldwide, impacting exports.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region provides strategic advantage for international trade due to access to the Gulf Coast, fueling the region's export business. Nearly 25% of industry establishments are located here.
Manufacturers choose this region for abundant natural gas and shale deposits, reducing costs. Access to key oil fields like Bakken and Woodford explains the predominance of establishments.
This region is located close to Canada, a crucial export market, facilitating efficient business and trade operations. Companies place facilities near consumers, raw materials and industrial regions.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The 1970 CAA is a comprehensive Federal law regulating all air emissions sources. It authorized the US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to establish National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS) to protect public health and the environment.
The CWA is the principal law governing pollution control and water quality of US waterways, restoring and maintaining the chemical, physical and biological integrity of the nation's waters.

The RCRA gives the EPA the authority to control hazardous waste from the cradle to the grave, including the generation, transportation, treatment, storage and disposal of hazardous waste. The RCRA also set forth a framework for the management of non-hazardous solid wastes.

regulations_points.regulation_title: COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION AND LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The CERCLA provides a Federal "Superfund" from the taxation of chemical and petroleum industries to clean up uncontrolled or abandoned hazardous waste sites, accidents, spills and other emergency releases of pollutants and contaminants into the environment.
The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) ensures safe and healthy working conditions by setting and enforcing standards and providing training, outreach, education and assistance.
Health and safety guidelines were established in 2020 amid the pandemic. Such guidelines advised temporary social distancing and ongoing additional sanitation measures within facilities.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The organic chemical manufacturing industry is in the mature stage of its life cycle.
The industry experiences high revenue volatility.
Organic chemical manufacturing is a highly capital-intensive industry.
The level of industry assistance for organic chemical manufacturing is low and steady.
The level of globalization in the industry is high and increasing.

basis_points.basis_title: Price and customer service drive competition
basis_points.basis_description: Price, customer service and customer reach drive industry competition. Given the commoditized nature of organic chemicals, prices are the central tenet of competition.
Capital is often required to adhere to government regulations. Complying with new regulations is a large competitive factor.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Organic chemical manufacturing is highly fragmented, with no dominant player having a significant revenue share, leading to a low concentration level.
There are many small organic chemical manufacturers, with less than a quarter having over 100 employees and a large majority having fewer than 20 employees.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Moderate technological change favors low concentration
concentration_points.concentration_description: Continued moderate technological advancement will consistently favor low market concentration as smaller companies enter to develop innovative processes.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Rising Purchase Costs Limit Revenue Growth
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs comprise the largest industry expense and have grown slightly over the past five years. Typically, as prices for purchase costs rise or decline, revenue will typically move in the opposite direction.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit Fluctuations Result from Commodity Pricing
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit has been subject to significantly volatile input costs, including those for crude oil, gas and petrochemicals, increasing organic chemical prices. Downstream demand from the industrial and construction sectors, which can be cyclical and determined by the state of the broader economy, influences organic chemical prices.

Since the labor market is becoming more competitive, manufacturers report significant expenses to hire skilled workers for specialist manufacturing. Despite this, wages as a share of revenue have come down.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Capital remains central to organic chemical manufacturing, driven by significant investment in automation, enabling products to be mass-produced.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for organic chemicals fluctuates in cycles and is directly influenced by the macroeconomic climate. Economic upturns boost demand, whereas downturns lead to decreased need.
The organic chemical industry faced major supply chain hurdles because of the pandemic. However, with the economy's solid recovery in 2021, sales have skyrocketed, compensating for the initial drop.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Larger companies have entered into joint ventures and strategic alliances on a domestic and international scale to combine expertise and drive innovation. Innovative manufacturing techniques aim to optimize processes, enhancing efficiency and accuracy. Also, these innovations help cut labor costs, reducing overheads and increasing overall profitability for companies.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: BIOTECHNOLOGY IN PRODUCING ORGANIC CHEMICALS HAS EXPANDED
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Biotechnological processes typically create fewer potentially harmful byproducts and waste materials, contributing to a drop in pollution and a smaller environmental impact, particularly in carbon emissions.

FAQs.question: How have imports from low-wage countries such as China and Mexico impacted your operations?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturing of bulk chemicals in China and Mexico has taken away revenue streams of smaller industry operators. An expected weakening of the US dollar over the next several years will likely make US products more competitive with international goods.

FAQs.question: Have exports offered an opportunity for your company?
FAQs.answer: Exports play an important role for both small and large chemical manufacturers. Exports have grown, and IBISWorld expects high-quality US goods to continue to be in high demand in global markets as economic activity ramps back up.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years? How has your company dealt with the most recent hydrocarbon price shock?
FAQs.answer: Volatile, but ultimately declining, crude oil prices have reduced selling prices of industry products. Companies that can secure a stable supply of low-cost inputs as global commodity prices tick higher during the economic recovery will likely earn greater profit.

FAQs.question: Have you looked into setting up manufacturing facilities in lower-wage regions of the country?
FAQs.answer: Larger industry players have facilities in low-wage countries. The level of globalization has increased over the past five years as more downstream industrial producers establish facilities overseas and seek to establish relationships with raw input producers, such as organic chemical manufacturers, in foreign countries.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Automation has increased however, wage costs have also increased as a share of revenue on account of a need for highly-technical and specialized labor.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology?
FAQs.answer: Technology has remained fairly stagnant in this industry over the past decade. Most technological developments are aimed at improving the efficiency of production processes and manufacturing assets.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Regulation has remained relatively steady for the US Organic Chemical Manufacturing industry. Various tariffs levied against raw inputs or final goods also restrict profitability; however, the industry has experienced minimal change in tariffs over the past.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: Both small and large industry operators are part of various trade and industry groups. Industry-relevant trade associations, such as the Society of Chemical Manufacturers and Affiliates (SOCMA), work as advocates and educators for the specialty chemical industry and batch and custom manufacturing processes.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Profit margins have fluctuated over the past five years due to swings in the price of raw inputs, such as hydrocarbons, petrochemicals and industrial gases, among other resources.

FAQs.question: Do you have any big projects on the horizon that will require capital financing?
FAQs.answer: The level of capital intensity is very high in this industry. Manufacturers primarily rely on heavy machinery, material handling equipment, storage equipment and computer systems for production. The historically low-interest rate environment allows companies to secure financing at low rates.

FAQs.question: How do you monitor changing environmental regulations?
Has your company encountered any regulatory issues over the past several years?
FAQs.answer: It is essential for industry operators to adhere to environmental concerns, pressures and regulations. Many industry players are in the process of reformulating their products (e.g. lowering greenhouse gas emissions) to comply with ever-stringent environmental requirements.

FAQs.question: What markets do you target? How has your company sought to diversify its products and clientele?
FAQs.answer: With many market segments subject to cyclical forces, it is important to have a diverse range of clients to help diversify risk and smooth out annual revenue. Producers with a mix of customers are better able to weather a general economic turndown since sales are less susceptible to considerable fluctuations when a producer is dependent on many customers rather than just a few concentrated buyers. Companies with a diverse customer portfolio will likely have fared better during the coronavirus pandemic and subsequent recovery.

FAQs.question: In which markets do you operate? Do you have the ability to expand abroad to sell your products?
FAQs.answer: With the industry increasingly becoming globalized, an industry player's global scale will continue to grow in importance as a competitive basis. As the US dollar weakens in value and global industrial activity resurges during the outlook period, exports will present industry operators with a significant opportunity to sell high-quality products to quickly growing markets.

FAQs.question: Does your company monitor changes in the trade-weighted index? How has import penetration affected your company?
FAQs.answer: An appreciating US dollar can negatively affect industry exports, as a stronger dollar makes US products more expensive and less attractive on the global market.

FAQs.question: Does your company have any supply contracts to hedge against volatile hydrocarbon prices? How effectively are you able to pass an increase in cost on to customers?
FAQs.answer: Since raw materials are a primary component of the industry's cost structure, the prices of raw hydrocarbon materials, such as crude oil, have a key bearing on industry performance. When the cost of oil increases, operators pass the extra cost down to the consumers. Companies that can secure raw materials at currently low costs will likely experience greater profit.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your revenue is accounted for by sales to industrial clients? How has your company reacted to falling demand from industrial customers in the past?
FAQs.answer: Many organic chemical products are intermediates used by a range of manufacturers to produce final goods or products. An increase in the industrial production index, which measures output by the mining, manufacturing, electric and gas industries, positively affects industry demand.
